intro: Symphoricarpos mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican snowberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Symphoricarpos mexicanus is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
